page.title: 19HUNTING NEAR STUBHAMPTON
page.content: There is a long history of these sports in the area and there have been some notable huntsmen in the past, including King John and Edward VII. In one part of the area artificial 'covers'are maintained for the rearing of pheasants and a few partridges, providing game for shooting each autumn.The copses,spinneys and gorse patches also provide sanctuaries for the foxes,which are hunted by the Portman Hunt.A small amount of deerstalking also takes place,as part of the managment of the deer population. There is also a fair degree of unofficial hunting and shooting taking place in the form of poaching.However,the old-fashioned methods have been replaced by professional commercialised stealing.
